creator: Frank FitzgeraldB
title: Arduino BLDC Motor- Ventilation and a Summer Cooler Device
description: This project is an alternative solution to a commercial exhaust fan, creating a ventilation and cooling device using an Arduino, a BLDC motor, and a propeller.
steps: Gather the necessary components: Arduino, 12v 2A DC Power Adapter, wire connectors, terminal block, brushless DC motor with ESC, switch, alligator clips, and a propeller.

Connect the 12VDC power adapter wires to the terminal block (negative out to ESC) and connect a wire inside the switch to the terminal block (positive out to ESC). Connect a wire from the negative and positive terminal block to the ESC (+ and -).

Connect the ESC to the BLDC motor (A to yellow, B to black, C to red). Solder the alligator clip to the ESC battery terminal. Connect the ESC wires (servo motor-like) to the Arduino: White to Digital Pin, Red to 5V, Black to GND. Clip the positive and negative wires from the terminal block to the ESC alligator clips.

Open the Arduino IDE, download the provided code, and upload it to the Arduino microcontroller. The speed will be limited to 90-105 as anything lower will not function and anything higher will reset the system.
Power up the system, without the propeller attached. Test the motor rotation direction (clockwise/counter-clockwise) and adjust the BLDC motor connections to the ESC (A and C) if needed.
Mount the system to a piece of wood using screws, nuts, and velcro. Place the device in the desired location. Assemble the propeller and enjoy.
